job_title: Fitness Instructor in University of Guelph, ON
pros:
Typically, the work environment was fun, young, and exciting. Many of the employees are students or have a keen interest in garnering support and appreciation among younger individuals to become physically active.

It is also a good starting position for novice instructors looking to gain experience.
cons: The pay scale is very difficult to climb, even for individuals with years of service working for the Athletics department. The department is very keen on keeping costs down and therefore, experienced instructors will find it difficult to obtain fair compensation compared to other private sector fitness facilities in Guelph.

review_title: Overall positive experience although experience can depends on your specific situation.
pros: Overall positive experience although experience can depend on your graduate supervisor and availability of grant funding and scholarships. Opportunities to travel and collaborate but you really have to self-advocate. Stipend and financial support are able to cover the basics. Rent in Guelph is about $1000 for a single apartment so you have enough for rent, food, gas etc. Student health benefits includes things like dental and phsyio. Graduate students are guaranteed teaching assistantships.
cons: Still required to pay compulsory fees and tuition. No real perks to being a graduate student.

job_title: Phd Student Researcher in Enfield, CT
pros: The university has flexibility with program courses, and this is adjusted based on where each person enters the program from. They have overarching goals that are built into all courses. Lots of opportunities for funding through teaching assistant and research assistant positions.
cons: There is an exceptionally heavy workload both for coursework, and for working as a teaching assistant. TA hours are generally 70 or 140 hours per contract, with the expectation being that you're working all these hours and your time being allocated almost to the minute.

review_title: Not the best time to be a professor at the University of Geulph.
job_title: Professor of Mathematics in Guelph, ON
pros: Freedom to work on my own projects, flexible hours.  You meet really interesting students and have stimulating colleagues.  More willing than most places to work across discipline boundaries.
cons: Some of the worst IT support in Canada, absolute mismatch between job goals and allocated resources.  Management increases workload while firing people for reasons that turn out to be imaginary after an audit.  Management priorities are set in a non-consultative manner - which might work a Star Bucks but is an abject failure at an institution of higher learning.  This place canceled the math major for several years - to meet budget goals.  Caused us to go into a worse budget hole as multi-million dollar grant getters left.

review_title: Good location for research faculty in a collegiate atmosphere
pros: Collegiate atmosphere, funding opportunities, assistance with grant writing, respected institution, history of respect from society
cons: This institution could not care less about the students. Yes, every once in a while I met a faculty member who cared. Within 1-2 years they would move on and be replaced by someone who avoided students at all costs so they could research things that did not even align with their teaching responsibilities/topics. The students are the ones missing out - but in terms of work, as I am a research professor, this is an excellent location with many opportunities for success. I just felt badly for the students at times...

review_title: A comfortable place to work but more career opportunities elsewhere
pros: An institution with a good reputation in Canada.  Nice campus.  The city of Guelph is a good place to live.  The people are generally friendly and pleasant to work with.  Flexible work hours offered a great work-life balance.   Access to courses at the university for personal development was a plus.
cons: Tends to be bureaucratic - which seems to be the case in most higher education institutions.  Funding levels have a big impact on allocation of money to departments and programs.  Some departmental decisions seem arbitrary and short-sighted.  Politics can be quite entrenched in some departments.  Not many opportunities for promotion but staff seem to stay because it is comfortable and the benefits are good.  Lack of consistent procedures for employee performance evaluation.

job_title: Student Caller in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Its right on campus and close to where classes are held if you are a student. Hours are flexible and you can get to know professionals who can give you advice or contacts to further your own career.
cons: If you are working as a student, in my work environment I feel as if I am treated a little like a child rather than an adult. My supervisors are very easy on us, and maybe a little too easy since this does not represent the real working world well. In the real word, you are pushed, sometimes past your limits to challenge you. I do not feel very challenged.

pros: Most of the job experiences at the University are reliant upon working with a good supervisor. For example, working in a lab can be wonderful if you are interested in the research and your supervisor treats you well. But it can be hell otherwise. Campus community is great and there's enough to do in the city.
cons: Guelph is a fairly small town, but it has everything you need without the big town issues. And Toronto is just an hour away anyway. Food options on campus could be better. Benefits don't come unless you're a student or have been employed for some years.

review_title: Laboratory Services Division - Laboratory work conditions & culture are horrible and there is little room for growth
pros:
- Pay is adequate
- Different union representations
- Work conditions are adequate
cons:
- Middle management is out of touch with the workload and what subordinates are actually doing
- Entry-level positions are sometimes difficult to attain (from an outside perspective)
- Little room for growth (unless you are well-liked by management)
- Workload is not equal
- See advice to management

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros: A great place for gaining experience and being challenged when teaching and evaluating students.
cons: Networking is a must and Department politics often get in the way of collaboration and improvement of facilities and working conditions. Often felt like favouritism ruled the workplace in the case of opportunities for work, projects, and resources. Much of my experience of being challenged as a teacher were due to professors or adjuncts not fulfilling their tasks adequately enough. The experience is appreciated, but we cannot say that this is something that was purposefully brought by the institution. It was a mere side-effect caused by poor management.

review_title: work and study at university of guelph
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant (GRA) in Guelph, ON
pros: Flexible time to work, as long as you meet the required working hours as GRA. Depend on your supervisor, I am lucky to be given an opportunity to work and learn about their project which is a new area for me.
cons: I work as GRA while studying at the University of Guelph and the salary itself would not be enough to cover my tuition and living cost, which means I should apply for other fundings such as scholarships, grants, etc or work as Graduate Teaching Assistant (GTA).

pros: Personal development, salary, work environment, mgt is genuine, students are better than most other programs in the area, food on campus is amazing, education is normally the focus (even of mgt, unless risk aversion is included in a decision)
cons: Location (Guelph is too far from Toronto, small town environment lacks culture), Union environment creates negativity where there doesn't need to be any, the rules from mgt often lack a learning focus, risk aversion is over the top - I am all for it, but not to this level.

review_title: I'm proud to be part of this university community, grateful for the opportunities to grow as a scholar and teacher.
pros: Being surrounded by high calibre scholars who also care deeply and about their teaching. An institutional cultural shift toward recognition of scholarship that is publicly oriented.
cons: inordinate emphasis, of late, on neoliberal cost-cutting; until recently, disdain at highest level of administration for professors as ancient relics; disregard for the arts; blind eye toward bullying.

pros: Great benefits,  access to gym,  parking,  friendly people once you were full time it was easier to have opportunity to apply and move elsewhere
cons:
There were 'boys club'type mentality that I got sick of.  And middle managment that had no management training but promoted from just length of career and made terrible managers.  Hard to get full time into you've been in a ridiculous amount of part time for years

I was managing with a coordinator title, so that made things negative on its own

review_title: A place where talent and education are squandered.
pros: Good colleagues, environmentally conscious faculty.
cons: Administration doesn't value teaching staff, micromanage professors, academic directors seem unqualified and lack basic teaching fundamentals.  Ask professors to implement technology without providing equipment or software. Academic directors follow latest fads without an understanding of it in a post secondary environment.

job_title: Summer Research Student in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Great environment, for the most part a very colourful environment. Well maintained greeneries is both relaxing and visually appealing. Staff are generally pleasant to work with, and most people are very open and friendly.
cons: MacN, the chemistry building, is very dated and very depressing to work in - a sharp contrast to the rest of the university.

pros: Accommodating to busy school schedule (very easy to balance work and school), you always feel like part of an amazing and strong team, constant challenges and opportunity to grow in the job and as a person.
cons: Challenges / situations in the job can be overwhelming at times, also the shifts available are very late nights in this position specifically.

pros: Small school means great access to resources, lots of 1 on 1 time with mentors. The lab spaces are great, and access to supplies is reasonable.
cons: The bureaucracy is awful, and everything takes forever. Every day from the start of the hiring process I felt bogged down by red tape. There isn't a lot of communication between departments, so interdisciplinary work can be challenging.

job_title: Human Resources Assistant in Guelph, ON
pros: I worked with lots of great people, a very beautiful campus, mostly modern buildings, the campus is central i the city and close to downtown but also good for commuting, very clean and beautiful grounds.
cons: The parking is very expensive for Guelph, the motivation in the workers can sometimes be lackluster due to security in jobs and lack of incentives.

job_title: Alumni Advancement Manager in Guelph, ON
pros:
Supportive work environment
Flexible hours, ability to work from home
Enjoy the people that I work with 
Free education as a perk to working there, I am doing my MBA right now
Love what I do, I am helping people, and improving lives
cons: There can be politics due to being in the public sector

pros: Great department, staff is always helpful and goes out of their way to make sure everything is available for you to do your job.
cons: The work is not hard, but it does come all at once. If you are assigned to a large class be prepared to have a lot of marking to do at once.

job_title: Food Service Handler in Guelph, ON
pros: I love working with the students  - it helps to keep me young.  My immedilate unit supervisor is great but the manager doesn't take much interest in any of the units he manages.
cons: Pay rates are not fair across the board for persons working in the same job levels. Experience should be rewarded.

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Guelph, ON
pros: Always meeting new people every week! The team is very organized and everyone works very well with each other. Fantastic definition of teamwork.
cons: The hours I worked were not as great - they were early in the morning for a couple hours, and then again in the evening for a couple of hours.

pros: Flexible hours, challenging work, supportive boss with excellent managerial skills. I was given the tools required to do the work expected.
cons: Expectations were sometimes vague and it was hard to tell whether or not I was doing an excellent job. Otherwise, the only con was that my office didn't have a window.

review_title: A great place to do your masters!
pros: The research is scientifically accurate, and as an agriculture student, it is the most well-recognized institiution in Canada. Highly suggested.
cons: Funding is tight, the work is hard, the hours are long.... but what other university isn't exactly the same? None.

job_title: PhD Candidate, Biochemistry in Guelph, ON
pros: Some of the profs are doing leading-edge research and are very passionate about their work which is contagious. The city is awesome to live in. Not a metropolis, but has many parks, recreational activities and very friendly people.
cons: The labs at Guelph do not have the amount of money to be spent on research as some of the bigger institutions would. It would be more difficult to publish in the higher impact journals.

review_title: A great place for graduate students
pros:
Teaching Assistant is a valuable experience for every graduate students. 
The working atmosphere in University of Guelph is fantastic. Most of the professor are very nice. Guys from CUPE3913 fight for TA's right hardly, which I appreciate. 
And TA benefits are quite good including high salaries and glasses benefits.
cons: I love University of Guelph that the TA work is so cool. I like it and there is no cons.

pros: Lots of time off to spend with my family in the summer and on holidays.  Great staff, management and food. Good hours for me. Good benefits. I like getting up in the morning and going to work, I really enjoy my job.  Fun talking to the students and getting to know them.
cons: Can get a little stressful at times when it gets really busy...but we manage and it doesn't last long.

job_title: Research Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros: It is a great atmosphere, and everyone is super friendly. Because not a lot of people or students are around in the summer, you get to know people much better and see familiar faces all the time. It is nice to walk around campus and see a familiar face. It is a small community and i love it.
cons: Downside is that i work alone in the lab most of the time

review_title: Great place if you don't care about compensation
pros:
Good Benefits package
Relatively laid back atmosphere
Supportive of learning + development
cons:
Salary is brutally low, and does not compare to private sector, not even close. For this reason alone, I will probably be leaving. 

Ridiculously management heavy. Numerous managers with 1-2 staff, some with no staff at all.

review_title: Nice and cozy environment to work !
job_title: Teaching and Research Assistant in Guelph, ON
pros: everyone stay quite closed. Other staffs are really helpful when you got problems. Focus on personal development. Providing lots opportunities to engage all people. Feels like really expose to a dense network.
cons: Less diversified culture to experience since most people are from local. Less structured and institutionalized routines to follow.Sometimes feel a bit lost and nowhere to find guidelines. Intra-department communications are not quite there yet.

pros:
- Close knit community with front and back of house working closely together
- Wide opportunity to touchbase with various different brands (eg: Starbucks, Subway, Booster Juice, Williams Coffee, etc)
- Inclusive manager that taught me everything he could from employer scheduling to financial management
- Never a dull moment surrounded by university setting
- Very accommodating to student schedules
cons: - Nothing much really from a part-time student's perspective.

pros: The University of Guelph is a great place for students in any major. It has comprehensive support for any need.
cons: Too far away from Toronto. Can be boring when students are away.

review_title: One hand you lose, the other hand you gain
pros: less pressure; nice environment; an easy place to live if having a family
cons: conservative; little communication with world leading Universities/Institutes in the field; little support to lab development and research work.

pros:
jobs including:
• Worked as Systems and Control Theory tutorial TA.
• Teach students how to analyze the behavior of closed loop systems using tools such as root locus, Routh-Hurwitz, Bode, Nyquist.
• Help the students solve their problem related to the course during ofﬁce hours
cons: Depends on the teacher you work with. Some are kind, some will push you very hard.

review_title: Hospitality Services, great place to work
job_title: Hospitality Services in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Friendly co-workers, flexible  hours, management genuinely cares about their staff.  Lots of healthy tasty food options to eat on your 1/2 hour break.  Easy transportation.  Surrounded by ambitious young people who have life goals.
cons: Minimum wage to start, when the university is closed there's no work other than that can't think of any

review_title: Universities aren't the gravy train they once were
job_title: Technology Analyst in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Nice environment, lots of intelligent people, interesting campus, some good learning opportunities
cons: Lack of work/life balance, underpaid for the level/scope of responsibility, limited upward mobility, "cutback" culture which has deflated morale

review_title: Job I have always wanted to get.
job_title: Assistant Manager, Purchasing Services in Guelph, ON
pros: Close to home.  Great people to work with.  Supportive mgnt.  Great environment.  Great benefits.  Plan to retire after this job.
cons: Some union issues with staff that hinder efficiency and productivity.

pros: Awesome people and environment in School of Engineering, supportive staff and faculty, nice polite and well behaved students. I really enjoyed working as a TA during my master;s program at  UoG.
cons: sometimes workload goes high, specially during exams, and this pressure applies to TAs which is not appropriate. For example, marking, invigilating exams during weekend, ...

review_title: A Great Place to Study & Work
pros: Beautiful, small campus that gives you the feeling of being part of a community. One of the most research intensive universities in Canada.
cons: Not the university to go to if you're looking for a lot of cultural diversity. Some areas around the downtown area are not the nicest to live in.

review_title: Pretty good work as a student
job_title: Alumni Caller Representation in Guelph, ON
pros: Worked doing calls at their alumni center - good work environment, nice summer job, respectful and flexible with regards to summer courses and exams.  Supervisors and management were fantastic.
cons: I worked in an outbound call center there, so... that's about it.

pros: Great benefits, pension plan, vacation time grows after years of service, tuition subsidy for yourself, and children, excellent athletics centre and reduced membership price for full time staff
cons: 24 hr per day operation, 365 days a year, depending on type of work, schedule is may not always be the best if departments that are essential service

job_title: IT Manager in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Excellent work/life balance and access to amenities; Opportunity to contribute to educating people and making a better world; Benefits are great;
cons: A University is a big bureaucracy, so it's often difficult to get things done; University funding models make IT innovation difficult; Salary often can't compete with the private sector;

job_title: Seasonal Faculty in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Rules are clear.  Flexibility to teach as i think will work.
cons: Permanence of sessional faculty

review_title: University of Guelph best in hospitality eleven years running
pros:
Chefs are personable and communicate with staff
Schedules are set and constant
Benefits include medical, dental, bus pass subsidy
cons: Starting a position at the beginning of the semester is stressful for everyone as the new students flood in and have as many questions as do the new hires!

review_title: The people are friendly, campus is beautiful
job_title: Research and Teaching Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros: U of G is probably the best university in Canada in terms of efficiency and reliability. The campus is so beautiful and green. Staffs at U of G are friendly, polite and do a great job of providing assistance to students!
cons: Student health services have been majorly disappointing

job_title: Customer Service Representative in Guelph, ON
pros: Flexible hours, good work environment, friendly, decent pay, plenty of job options, organized shift scheduling, generally a good relationship between management and staff.
cons: Some managers do not treat their staff with the respect they deserve (ie. throwing them under the bus), may not always receive the number of hours you request.

job_title: Ph D Student in Guelph, ON
pros: Great research going on at the university of Guelph. The culture is very collaborative between scientists and departments. Great place to for a graduate degree.
cons: There aren't many to name. The experiences of graduate students vary from Professor to Professor.

pros: Staff are very helpful and the school really works with you to help you out and
cons: Very hard to get in the University because the organization is so unionized, so they hire internally before looking externally; also hard when you are a contract worker to get a permanent position.

job_title: Student Research Assistant in Guelph, ON
pros: Got to choose my own work hours, as long as I put in the required time each day.
cons: Usually required to come in on evenings/weekends when experiments required.

pros: The buildings and city are really nice  ... good to very good professors.
cons: Not the most recognized in Computer Science.

pros: Flexible hours, good medical coverage in you are PR
cons: Poor salary, too much work, poor contract duration often extended as 3 months at a time

job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Guelph, ON
pros:
Independent thinking and research
Collaborative environment
Open and positive academic environment
Great animal research facilities
cons:
Not competitive
Too lax atmosphere
Little teaching assistant positions for non-vet degree holders in Ontario vet college

pros: flexible hours with even pay. great workspace and minimal commitment. i learned valuable communication skill and enhanced my ability to speak with a variety of individuals and groups
cons: however, can only apply for this job is you are a student at the University

review_title: TAship: good money to help pay grad school bills
pros: I was doing my PhD, so the TAship was offered in order to assist with financials
cons: When combined with a  PhD, being a TA cuts down on the time you have to focus on studies

review_title: It really depends who you work with
job_title: Postdoctoral Research Fellow in University of Guelph, ON
pros: If you join a great team with good people working for the University of Guelph can be great.
cons: Lower pay than government or industry. Low job security. Your experience will largely depend on what research team you join.

review_title: Interesting work, limited pay and graduate course offerings
job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Guelph, ON
pros: Interesting work, lots of travel and opportunities post graduation.
cons: Graduate student salary has not kept up with cost of living. Could use more advanced graduate courses as the selection is quite limited.

review_title: A pleasure to be a student in UofG
job_title: Anonymous Employee in University of Guelph, ON
pros: I felt like working with family members when I was a graduate teaching assistant. My colleagues and my teacher are all really nice.
cons: There are not many choices for statistics graduates to choose their courses.

pros:
- Flexible hours
- Convenient work location
- Interesting work
cons:
- No benefits
- Lower wage despite increased role in the department

pros: It's a beautiful campus and the scholarship is top notch.
cons: The winters are pretty hard in this area. Guelph is also not a very large city, it has a relatively rural feel and you need a car to get around.

review_title: Fun, Flexible and Full of Perks!
pros:
- flexible hours
- friendly management
- great hours (no working in the evenings)
- meal cards for free food on campus! 
- convenient location - I'm already there anyways
cons: - minimum wage (but that's what you expect)

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros:
-Very cordial work environment
-Compensation excellent considering renumeration and number of hours worked
cons: -At times, graduate enrolment exceeded number of graduate research assistantship positions available

pros: Excellent research  infrastructure at the Bioproducts Discovery and Development Centre. Plant Ag. Department's administration staff very nice and helpful. Lots of opportunities to build up research skills and improve your resume.
cons: Work-life balance sometimes outweighs towards the work side.

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Guelph, ON
pros: Working at the University of Guelph was a rewarding experience filled with friendly people, helpful associates, and cutting-edge research.
cons: Many projects and research were self-driven and required a lot of self-learning to keep up with everyone else.

review_title: Enjoyed my experiance working at the University of Guelph to solve new problems.
job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Collaborative, Cutting-Edge technology, Good support, Good Learning environment
cons: University of Guelph is a well recognized university, and there were no glaring cons for me about my experiance.

pros: Overal, UofGuelph is an excellent place to work. However, as a postdoctoral fellow, your final experience will be highly associated to your supervisor and research project or agreement.
cons: Hard to park on campus.

job_title: Research Assistant in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Close to home, flexible work hours, job security, problem solving
cons: Same problems arise with little resolution from first predicament

job_title: PhD Student in University of Guelph, ON
pros: A lot of great people and the stipend for a grad student is good
cons: MacN building getting very run down, many issues should be fixed by the ongoing renovations though

job_title: Graduate Research Assistant in Guelph, ON
pros:
- Great working environment (though this depends on your supervisor)
- The city of Guelph is a great place to live
- Health insurance is decent
cons: - Some other universities will pay your tuition

pros: Great benefits, good pay, strong union.
cons: It's a bureaucratic nightmare.  I tell people I work a "the last outpost of the Soviet Union".

job_title: Postdoctoral Research Associate in Guelph, ON
pros: It's a very important job, that gives us a good experience teaching and with nice work on the publications side too.
cons: It needs to give more job opportunities for workers who work there.

review_title: Great working environment that I would recommend to a friend
job_title: Undergraduate Research Assistant in University of Guelph, ON

-Supportive supervisors that will help you overcome obstacles
cons:

-Lots of lab work to be done within a short time

job_title: Postdoctoral Fellow in University of Guelph, ON

cons: General cost of living in Canada is high, and this is a vital consideration for international workers.

pros:
- you get to work with a lot of new people

cons: - you don't get paid

pros: Great supervisors! My supervisor would prepare gifts for each festival including
cons:
If you care about pay, then this might be a con.

job_title: Teaching Assistant in University of Guelph, ON

cons: Required the high ability of time control to finish the jobs and own studies.

review_title: Good working environment, excellent co workers
pros: There is a generally cooperative atmosphere among the staff
cons: Always short-staffed apparently as a strategy to keep costs lower.

review_title: A wonderful environment and a lovely campus
job_title: PhD Graduate Student in Guelph, ON

cons: Occasionally it was difficult to identify and complete the required paperwork without assistance

job_title: Residence Life Staff in Guelph, ON
pros: It was great way of meeting and engaging with people. Taught me leadership skills and organizational skills.
cons: Not anything. Everything was great

pros: Open door policy, Well organized network. Team and community building was priority.
cons: Could be cliquey at times.

pros: Tuition waiver for employees and children of employees. Great benefits. Very competitive pay.

review_title: Great job if you can get it!

Flexible schedule.
The work is easy once you get the hang of it.
Build editing skills.
Great colleagues.

job_title: Masters Candidate in University of Guelph, ON
pros: Professors genuinely care about the students and try to help in whatever manner they are able to
cons: Food on campus is generally more costly than off-campus

review_title: A very good environment to work at
pros: The University of Guelph has an exciting campus and friendly environment.
cons: Needs to be developed in different areas like all places.

job_title: Graduate Teaching Assistant in Guelph, ON

review_title: It is nice to work in this university ,nice people ,nice enviroment

pros: Located in  a small, nice, and safe city. Good benefit package.

job_title: Call Center Representative in Guelph, ON

cons: the pay was not ideal but then again, its expected to make minimum wage with this kind of position

pros: A Detail-Oriented and hard working individual with experience in market research and client relationships.

job_title: Weight Trainer Supervisor in Guelph, ON
pros:
- fitness knowledge one builds
